page.title: 01A Guide to Dumfries
page.content: Our area of{Dumfries}is separated by the river Nith. On the East side lies {Whitesands,}and the built up area of Victorian houses surrounding the town centre.{Georgetown}and{Lochvale}are the two newest suburbs of Dumfries. Also on the east side is the Dock Park, and south from that, is the small village of{Kingolm Quay}where ships coming up the Nith used to dock. On the west side are the housing estates of{Troqueer}and{Maxwelltown. They both centre around Corbelly Hill, the museum with its camera obscura. Troqueer school and playing fields take up a large area. The land around Dumfries is generally wide, open fields and the only roads to Dumfries are main roads. There are some small farms and cottages.
